bibl.title: William H. Geary and William Williams v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court for the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory holding terms at Port Townsend for the Counties of Jefferson, Clallam Island and Whatcom
The Resident of the U.S. to J.J.H. VanBokkelen Deputy US Marshall of Wash Territory Greeting:

We command you that you have the bodies od William H. Geary and William Williams, by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever names said William H. Geary and William Williams, shall be called or charged, before the Hon. Orange Jacobs, Judge of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory at the Court room of the District Court of said District in and for the 3rd Judicial District at Port Townsend Jefferson County on the 12th day of may at 10 o'clock in the forenoon of that day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said William H. Geary and William Williams, and have you then and there this writ.
Witness the Hon O Jacobs Judge of the siad Dist. Court for the 3rd Jud District of W.T. at Port Townsend this 9th day of May A.D. 1873
